caller_intent: Barbara Greenbaum contacted Alliance Insurance to clarify a confusing document received from Cincinnati Insurance, which she mistakenly thought was a bill rather than policy-related information. She wanted to confirm whether she needed to pay it, given her homeowners insurance is escrowed through her mortgage company.
resolution_steps: Agent verified Barbara's identity using her name, address, and account details.
Agent checked Barbara's account to identify the source of the email and policy details.

Agent explained the document was related to a March 2026 policy renewal and clarified it was a bill sent to her mortgage company (Atlantic Bay Mortgage Group), with Barbara receiving a copy as part of the process.
Agent confirmed the $1,411 premium was due on March 3, 2026, and noted the mortgage company was listed as the 'mortgagee' on the invoice.
knowledge_required: Understanding of policy renewal processes and escrow billing for homeowners insurance
Ability to access and interpret client account details
Knowledge of how mortgage companies interact with insurance carriers
systems_referenced: Internal account management system for policy details
summary: Barbara Greenbaum contacted Alliance Insurance to clarify a confusing document from Cincinnati Insurance, which she thought was a bill. The agent explained it was a policy renewal notice sent to her mortgage company, with Barbara receiving a copy. The agent confirmed the document's purpose and due date, resolving her confusion.
